description: This course will survey the discipline of molecular genetics. Two broad areas will be considered 1) Molecular Biology: DNA replication, transcription, translation, regulation of gene expression in both prokaryotic and eukaryotic systems, and genomics and 2) Genetics: basic Mendelian & molecular genetics.
name: MOLEC. BIOL. & GENETICS

values.comments:
A survey course of molecular genetics, BIOL221 covers two major areas. First, it
covers the basics of molecular biology, which includes DNA replication, transcription,
translation, and regulation of gene expression in prokaryotic and eukaryotic systems, and
genomics. Second, the class introduces Mendelian and molecular genetics.
There appeared to be a diverse collection of sentiments in regards to the material
covered in the course. Some students were extremely dissatisfied with the material
covered and felt that content covered in class was very “superficial.” Others were content
with the amount of material covered and even felt that there may have been too much.
Professor Guild received a full spectrum of reviews ranging from one student
saying he was “one of the best professors” he has ever had to another saying he is “not
the best teacher for the course.” As many students as there were who felt that Professor
Guild was a “passionate” and enthusiastic lecturer, there were an equal number who
thought classes were very boring. It is clear that his unique teaching style appeals to some
but not to others. Most, however, agreed that regardless of his teaching abilities,
Professor Guild made himself very available and helpful outside of class.
Students agreed that exams were very long and difficult to complete in the
allotted 50 minutes. Students felt this was the major reason why the average score on
exams was in the 50-60% range. The class was mostly composed of underclassmen,
primarily biological science majors. Overall, they felt the course was very challenging
and required a lot of effort to do well.
